eS-PXY0tBknvQfzvtsEIZA.text: I tried hard to look for a flaw in this place. Desperately peering in every corner to find a half eaten bacon roll wedged under something (usually someones foot), but I couldn't find anything.  This place was spotless, but that's where it's biggest downfall is. It's too perfect and lacks a little character. But who cares when they serve really good cheap food.  Get the Bacon Roll, pre-trampled.

photos.caption: Photo of The Koffee Pot - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

PB2VUSCsu6KyWyR5Se4-MA.text: i come here quite a lot as my friend lives in a flat only 2 minutes around the corner from here.  Much like the decor, simplicity is they key at Koffee Pot. It is a good, cheaper alternative to the generic coffee shops around town. Koffee Pot makes a good option for lunch if you are are keen on having a full tummy on a budget.  Koffee Pot is about as average as it gets, it doesn't step out of line, the food is good, the layout is good, the price is good. But on the other hand it doesn't do anything that makes it more than ok.

photos.caption: Photo of The Koffee Pot - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8yeaJvIv830s7wQRMKOSlg.text: An excellent traditional cafe. We have never had any item on a dish here which was not properly cooked! The breakfasts are lovely. Service is fast and friendly. Worth traveling to the Gorgie area just to sample the food! Can also recommend the Malinka {Armenian] honey cake and coffee.

-OsWiO75vLmXfRRu66V4pQ.text: This is one of the first cafes I went into when I moved to Edinburgh, it is cheap and cheerful, with hearty meals and snacks and a good old cup of tea or coffee. It is clean and tidy and the staff are pleasant and friendly. Now visit here everytime I am shopping in Gorgie. Great place.

Bnc4NhcIgiKW87al3oTX4Q.text: This cafe' great its cheap the meals are good and they do a great mug of coffee, the staff are efficient and friendly and the place is always spotless. I've been in here loads of times over the years and the kids like the place too.
